static.title: arbitrary-send-eth
static.description:
VulnerableContract.emergencyWithdraw() (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#46-49) sends eth to arbitrary user
	Dangerous calls:
	- address(tx.origin).transfer(address(this).balance) (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#48)

static.title: reentrancy-eth
static.description:
Reentrancy in VulnerableContract.withdraw(uint256) (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#33-43):
	External calls:
	- (success) = msg.sender.call{value: amount}() (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#37)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- balances[msg.sender] -= amount (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#40)
	VulnerableContract.balances (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#9) can be used in cross function reentrancies:
	- VulnerableContract.balances (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#9)
	- VulnerableContract.deposit() (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#62-65)
	- VulnerableContract.receive() (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#94-97)
	- VulnerableContract.secureWithdraw(uint256) (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#81-91)
	- VulnerableContract.withdraw(uint256) (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#33-43)

static.title: tx-origin
static.description: VulnerableContract.emergencyWithdraw() (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#46-49) uses tx.origin for authorization: require(bool,string)(tx.origin == owner,Not authorized) (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#47)

static.title: unchecked-lowlevel
static.description: VulnerableContract.unsafeTransfer(address,uint256) (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#57-59) ignores return value by to.call{value: amount}() (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#58)

static.title: missing-zero-check
static.description:
VulnerableContract.changeOwner(address).newOwner (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#75) lacks a zero-check on :
		- owner = newOwner (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#77)

static.title: missing-zero-check
static.description:
VulnerableContract.unsafeTransfer(address,uint256).to (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#57) lacks a zero-check on :
		- to.call{value: amount}() (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#58)

static.title: calls-loop
static.description: VulnerableContract.massTransfer(address[],uint256) (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#68-72) has external calls inside a loop: address(recipients[i]).transfer(amount) (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#70)

static.title: reentrancy-events
static.description:
Reentrancy in VulnerableContract.withdraw(uint256) (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#33-43):
	External calls:
	- (success) = msg.sender.call{value: amount}() (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#37)
	Event emitted after the call(s):
	- Withdrawal(msg.sender,amount) (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#42)

static.title: reentrancy-events
static.description:
Reentrancy in VulnerableContract.secureWithdraw(uint256) (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#81-91):
	External calls:
	- (success) = msg.sender.call{value: amount}() (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#87)
	Event emitted after the call(s):
	- Withdrawal(msg.sender,amount) (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#90)

static.title: timestamp
static.description:
VulnerableContract.timeLock() (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#52-54) uses timestamp for comparisons
	Dangerous comparisons:
	- block.timestamp > 1234567890 (contracts/VulnerableContract.sol#53)
